Associates are also expected to remain at work for their entire work schedule. Late arrival, early departure, or other absences from scheduled hours are disruptive and must be avoided.

Excessive absenteeism is defined as two or more occurrences of unexcused absence in a 30-day period or three or more occurrences in a 90-day period, and will result in disciplinary action. Eight occurrences of unexcused absence in a 12-month period are considered grounds for termination.

Associates who are absent for two or more consecutive days due to illness or injury must provide a doctor's release to the Human Resources department before returning to work. Associates who fail to report to work for a period of one day or more without notifying their supervisor will be considered to have abandoned their job and voluntarily terminated their employment relationship.

Associates are also expected to remain at work for their entire work schedule. Late arrival, early departure, or other absences from scheduled hours are disruptive and must be avoided.

Excessive absenteeism is defined as two or more occurrences of unexcused absence in a 30-day period or three or more occurrences in a 90-day period. This will result in disciplinary action. Eight occurrences of unexcused absence in a 12-month period are considered grounds for termination.

Associates who are absent for two or more consecutive days due to illness or injury must provide proof of physician's care and a fitness for duty release prior to returning to work. Associates must also take earned PTO for every absence unless otherwise allowed by company policy.

Associates who fail to report to work for a period of one day or more without notifying their supervisor will be considered to have abandoned their job and voluntarily terminated their employment relationship.

What is the company's policy on substance abuse, and what are the consequences of violating this policy?': According to the company's policy, substance abuse is strictly prohibited, and associates are expected to be free from the influence of illegal drugs, alcohol, or controlled substances while on company property, company worksites, or while on company business. The consequences of violating this policy include:

* Immediate termination of employment if an associate tests positive for drugs, alcohol, or other hazardous substances.
* Termination of employment if an associate is found to be in possession of, using, or selling illegal drugs while on company property, company worksites, or while on company business.
* Disciplinary action, up to and including termination, if an associate is arrested or convicted for driving under the influence or for violation of a criminal drug statute.
* Mandatory drug testing in certain circumstances, such as after an accident or if a supervisor suspects an associate of being impaired.
* Searches of an associate's person, personal articles, or vehicle if there is suspicion of substance abuse.

Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and will take swift and severe action against any associate who violates this policy.

What are the company's expectations regarding associate attendance and punctuality, and what are the consequences of excessive absenteeism?': According to the text, MD Billing expects associates to report to work as scheduled, on time, and prepared to start working. Associates are also expected to remain at work for their entire work schedule. Late arrival, early departure, or other absences from scheduled hours are disruptive and must be avoided.

Excessive absenteeism is defined as two or more occurrences of unexcused absence in a 30-day period or three or more occurrences in a 90-day period. This will result in disciplinary action. Eight occurrences of unexcused absence in a 12-month period are considered grounds for termination.

Associates who are absent for two or more consecutive days due to illness or injury must provide proof of physician's care and a fitness for duty release prior to returning to work. Associates must also take earned PTO for every absence unless otherwise allowed by company policy.

Associates who fail to report to work for a period of one day or more without notifying their supervisor will be considered to have abandoned their job and voluntarily terminated their employment relationship.

What are the company's expectations regarding associate attendance and punctuality, and what are the consequences of excessive absenteeism?': According to the text, MD Billing expects associates to report to work as scheduled, on time, and prepared to start working. Associates are also expected to remain at work for their entire work schedule. Late arrival, early departure, or other absences from scheduled hours are disruptive and must be avoided.

Excessive absenteeism is defined as two or more occurrences of unexcused absence in a 30-day period or three or more occurrences in a 90-day period. This will result in disciplinary action. Eight occurrences of unexcused absence in a 12-month period are considered grounds for termination.

Associates who are absent for two or more consecutive days due to illness or injury must provide proof of physician's care and a fitness for duty release prior to returning to work. Associates must also take earned PTO for every absence unless otherwise allowed by company policy.

Tardiness and early departures are each considered one-half an occurrence for the purpose of discipline under this policy. Associates who must leave work before the end of their scheduled shift must notify a supervisor immediately.

Associates who are absent for two or more consecutive days due to illness or injury must provide proof of physician's care and a fitness for duty release prior to returning to work. Associates must also take earned PTO for every absence unless otherwise allowed by company policy.

* Pre-employment testing for all applicants.
* For-cause testing if a supervisor suspects an associate may be impaired or using substances.
* Post-accident testing if an associate is involved in a reportable accident.
* Return-to-service testing after an associate returns to work after time away from employment.
* Random testing at the discretion of management.

(Answer: The company has a zero-tolerance policy towards substance abuse, and it prohibits associates from using, selling, possessing, or being under the influence of illegal drugs or controlled substances while on company property or on company business. 3. What are the company's expectations regarding associate attendance and punctuality, and what are the consequences of excessive absenteeism?

(Answer: The company expects associates to report to work on time and to be regular in their attendance. Excessive absenteeism is defined as two or more occurrences of unexcused absence in a 30-day period or three or more occurrences in a 90-day period, and it may result in disciplinary action, including termination.)

4. What is the company's policy on social media use, and what are the guidelines for associates who use social media?

(Answer: The company recognizes the importance of social media, but it also expects associates to use social media responsibly and in a way that does not harm the company's reputation. Associates are expected to follow the company's guidelines for social media use, which include being respectful, maintaining accuracy and confidentiality, and not engaging in behavior that could be considered harassment or bullying.)

5. What is the company's policy on substance abuse, and what are the consequences of violating this policy?

(Answer: The company has a zero-tolerance policy towards substance abuse, and it prohibits associates from using, selling, possessing, or being under the influence of illegal drugs or controlled substances while on company property or on company business. Violating this policy may result in disciplinary action, including termination.)

Associates who fail to report to work for a period of one day or more without notifying their supervisor will be considered to have abandoned their job and voluntarily terminated their employment relationship.

* Mandatory drug testing in certain circumstances, such as after an accident or if a supervisor suspects an associate of being impaired.
* Searches of an associate's person, personal articles, or vehicle if there is suspicion of substance abuse.

Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and will take swift and severe action against any associate who violates this policy.

The consequences of violating this policy include:

* Immediate termination of employment if an associate tests positive for drugs, alcohol, or other hazardous substances.
* Termination of employment if an associate is found to be in possession of, using, or selling illegal drugs while on company property, company worksites, or while on company business.
* Disciplinary action, up to and including termination, if an associate is arrested or convicted for driving under the influence or for violation of a criminal drug statute.
* Mandatory drug testing in certain circumstances, such as after an accident or if a supervisor suspects an associate of being impaired.
* Searches of an associate's person, personal articles, or vehicle if there is suspicion of substance abuse.

Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and will take swift and severe action against any associate who violates this policy.

Additionally, associates who are found to be in possession of, using, or selling substances on company property or while on company business will also be terminated immediately and may be subject to criminal investigation and/or prosecution.

The company also requires associates to report any prescription medications that may affect their ability to perform their job safely, and failure to comply with this requirement may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment.

Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and expects all associates to adhere to this policy to maintain a safe and healthy work environment.

**Second Response**

The company's policy on substance abuse is outlined in the associate handbook, which states that substance abuse is a serious matter that will not be tolerated. The company prohibits associates from using, selling, possessing, or being under the influence of illegal drugs, alcohol, or controlled substances while on company property, company worksites, or while on company business.

The consequences of violating this policy include termination of employment, as well as possible criminal investigation and/or prosecution. The company also reserves the right to conduct drug testing in various circumstances, including pre-employment, for-cause, post-accident, and random testing.

Associates are expected to report any prescription medications that may affect their ability to perform their job safely, and failure to comply with this requirement may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment. Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and expects all associates to adhere to this policy to maintain a safe and healthy work environment.

* The guidelines include:
	+ Maintaining the confidentiality of Company trade secrets, intellectual property, and confidential Company-related commercially-sensitive information.
	+ Not creating a link from a personal blog, website, or other social networking site to a Company website that identifies the associate as speaking on behalf of the Company.

	+ Reporting any media inquiries for official Company responses to Human Resources.

Associates are also expected to be respectful and courteous in their social media activity, and not to engage in behavior that could offend, intimidate, embarrass, or upset any other person. What are the company's expectations regarding attendance and punctuality, and what are the consequences of excessive absenteeism?': According to the text, the company expects associates to report to work as scheduled, on time, and prepared to start working. Associates are also expected to remain at work for their entire work schedule. Late arrival, early departure, or other absences from scheduled hours are considered disruptive and must be avoided.

Excessive absenteeism is defined as two or more occurrences of unexcused absence in a 30-day period or three or more occurrences in a 90-day period. This can result in disciplinary action, including termination of employment. Specifically, eight occurrences of unexcused absence in a 12-month period are considered grounds for termination.

Associates who are absent for two or more consecutive days due to illness or injury must provide proof of physician's care and a fitness-for-duty release prior to returning to work. Additionally, associates who fail to report to work for a period of one day or more without notifying their supervisor will be considered to have abandoned their job and voluntarily terminated their employment relationship.

The consequences of violating this policy include:

* Immediate termination of employment if an associate tests positive for drugs, alcohol, or other hazardous substances.
* Termination of employment if an associate is found to be in possession of, using, or selling illegal drugs while on company property, company worksites, or while on company business.
* Disciplinary action, up to and including termination, if an associate is arrested or convicted for driving under the influence or for violation of a criminal drug statute.
* Mandatory drug testing in certain circumstances, such as after an accident or if a supervisor suspects an associate of being impaired.
* Searches of an associate's person, personal articles, or vehicle if there is suspicion of substance abuse.

Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and will take swift and severe action against any associate who violates this policy.

Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and expects all associates to adhere to this policy to maintain a safe and healthy work environment.

What is the company's policy on substance abuse, and what are the consequences of violating this policy?': According to the company's policy, substance abuse is strictly prohibited, and associates are expected to be free from the influence of illegal drugs, alcohol, or controlled substances while on company property, company worksites, or while on company business. The consequences of violating this policy include:

* Immediate termination of employment if an associate tests positive for drugs, alcohol, or other hazardous substances.
* Termination of employment if an associate is found to be in possession of, using, or under the influence of illegal drugs, alcohol, or controlled substances while on company property, company worksites, or while on company business.
* Disciplinary action, up to and including termination, if an associate is arrested or convicted for driving under the influence or for violation of a criminal drug statute.
* Mandatory drug testing in certain circumstances, such as after an accident or if a supervisor suspects an associate of being impaired.

Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and will take swift and severe action against any associate who violates this policy.

The consequences of violating this policy include:

* Immediate termination of employment if an associate tests positive for drugs, alcohol, or other hazardous substances.
* Termination of employment if an associate is found to be in possession of, using, or selling illegal drugs while on company property, company worksites, or while on company business.
* Disciplinary action, up to and including termination, if an associate is arrested or convicted for driving under the influence or for violation of a criminal drug statute.
* Mandatory drug testing in certain circumstances, such as after an accident or if a supervisor suspects an associate of being impaired.
* Searches of an associate's person, personal articles, or vehicle if there is suspicion of substance abuse.

Overall, the company takes a zero-tolerance approach to substance abuse and will take swift and severe action against any associate who violates this policy.

Associates who are absent for two or more consecutive days due to illness or injury must provide proof of physician's care and a fitness for duty release prior to returning to work.
